intro: Aeschynanthus consobrinus, commonly known as the red-tipped pelargonium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright orange or red flowers that are typically borne on long, slender stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Aeschynanthus consobrinus is popular as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in hanging baskets or containers.
